summary: Court Wood was a student with pro-Castro sentiments in 1961. He had recently returned from Cuba under the sponsorship of the FAIR PLAY FOR CUBA COMMITTEE. He was of interest to the CIA, who had Michael Stratton cultivate a relationship with him to gather information. Stratton reported on Wood's involvement with the FAIR PLAY FOR CUBA COMMITTEE and his plans to illegally enter Cuba. Stratton also requested guidance on his relationship with Wood and his father.
significance: Court Wood's significance in the JFK context lies in his connection to the FAIR PLAY FOR CUBA COMMITTEE and his pro-Castro sentiments during a period of heightened tensions between the United States and Cuba. The CIA's interest in monitoring his activities suggests concerns about potential threats or subversive activities related to Cuba.
